intro: Sobiso japonica, commonly known as Japanese sobisa, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Sobiso japonica thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas.
